stimulusHtml: If θ i is varied, is it possible for the beam to be totally internally reflected? Why or why not?

features.html: A beam of light in a transparent medium with index of refraction n 1 is incident on the boundary with another transparent medium with a greater index of refraction, n2. The incident beam makes an angle θi with the normal, as shown.

choicesHtml: Yes, because a portion of the beam is always reflected back whenever it encounters a new medium
Yes, because there will be an incident angle for which the refracted angle is 90°
No, because a transparent medium must allow light to travel through it
No, because the beam will always refract toward the normal when going into a medium of greater index of refraction
